From Paris to Pittsburgh, the climate crisis affects everyone. It’s time to say “We are still in.” I’m proud to support H.R. 9, the #ClimateActionNow Act, which blocks Trump from pulling the U.S. out of the Paris Agreement. #ActOnClimate pic.twitter.com/ZRK1tiyHT5

We're faced with a historic opportunity: to create a clean energy economy that provides good-paying jobs, cleaner air for our children & a safer climate for future generations. I support legislation blocking Trump from pulling us out of the Paris Agreement. #ClimateActionNow pic.twitter.com/xACkVOgOSN

As Chairman of the @AppropsDems CJS Subcommittee that oversees funding for @NOAA, I'm proud to see its @CCRUN_RISA program working in #TheBronx. They have identified neighborhoods at greatest risk from extreme heat and how to mitigate this problem: pic.twitter.com/QbtGrrV3j5

As Chairman of the @AppropsDems CJS Subcommittee, I oversee funding for the #2020Census. Next week, I will chair a hearing with the Director of the @uscensusbureau, Steven Dillingham. I look forward to discussing their budget request in this crucial year.

Including a citizenship question will deter participation in the #2020census & alienate marginalized communities who fear the Trump Administration. It will undermine accuracy and prevent federal dollars from going to where they are needed.

Today, #SCOTUS meets to hear arguments on the legality and constitutionality of the Trump Administration's decision to add a citizenship question to the #2020Census. The decision to add such a question violates our laws, processes, good science, and the Constitution.
